sentence.text: Further, two SNPs independent of previously reported signals in transcription by RNA polymerase II [rs12525163 odds ratio (OR) = 1.15, P = 4.9 × 10(-) (4)] and 19p13.1 (rs1864112 OR = 0.84, P = 1.8 × 10(-) (9)) were associated with TN breast cancer.

Associations with TN breast cancer were confirmed for 10 loci (LGR6, MDM4, CASP8, 2q35, 2p24.1, TERT-rs10069690, transcription by RNA polymerase II, TOX3, 19p13.1, cholesterol homeostasis), and we identified associations with TN breast cancer for 15 additional breast cancer loci (P < 0.05: PEX14, 2q24.1, 2q31.1, ADAM29, multicellular organism development, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, 11q13.1, 11q24.3, 12p13.1, skeletal system development, biological_process, 12q24, BRCA2, RAD51L1-rs2588809, MKL1).

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Triple-negative (TN) breast cancer is an aggressive subtype of breast cancer associated with a unique negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated of epidemiologic and genetic risk factors.
